title: BBC Local Live: Devon & Cornwall on Tuesday 4 July 2017 - BBC News
summary: no confidence motion passed in police and crime commissioner .
'despondent ' man taken to hospital after dartmoor search .
garage forecourt crash : woman killed named by police .
'lax safeguarding attitude ' head teacher banned from teaching .
protest pushes for better help for disabled children in cornwall .
torquay 's palace hotel to close at end of july .
motorist stopped by police for cleaning teeth while driving .
calls for post-brexit laws to protect dolphins from fishing gear .
more news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 08:00 on wednesday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .

documents.title: fisheries minister 'would keep eu rules to protect dolphins post-brexit '
text: camborne & redruth mp and fisheries minister george eustice has said he would keep eu rules to protect dolphins after brexit .
campaigners said there must be laws in place post-brexit to protect dolphins from dying in fishing nets and gear .
a petition to mr eustice has reached about 54,000 signatures amid fears most of the protection currently comes from the eu .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: protest for disabled : 'my daughter was out of education for six months for case to be assessed '
text: a protest has been held outside county hall in truro to push for better help for disabled children in cornwall .
parents said their children were being failed by the health and education systems in the county .
michelle huff said her daughter was out of education for six months while her case was assessed .
she said : `` i had to fight to get her into a special school .
my daughter should never have had to go through that .
it was detrimental to her health and detrimental to mine . ''
cornwall council said it recognised the importance in the provision of high quality services to keep children and young people safe , and enabling them to make good or better progress .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: fire crews called to two suspect fires at derelict newquay hotel
text: firefighters in cornwall were called to the same derelict building twice in less than three days to deal with suspect fires .
crews from newquay , st columb and penzance put out a fire this morning after being called to the outbuilding at the former beresford hotel in narrowcliff , newquay , at about 06:30 .
fire crews had to deal with a `` quite big '' and `` substantial '' blaze at the site on sunday evening .
today they also had to call in an environmental support vehicle from penzance , which deals with decontamination , after asbestos was found .
police are investigating the cause of the blazes .
author: Amy Gladwell, BBC News Online

documents.title: latest weather : showers clearing and a warm wednesday
text: any light showers will clear away eastwards to leave a largely dry night with clear spells developing .
winds will become mainly north or northeasterly and light or moderate in strength .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
wednesday will be a warm and dry day , with sunny spells and patchy cloud .
northeasterly winds will be mainly light or moderate , but locally fresh over exposed parts of the south coast .
maximum temperature : 25c ( 77f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: woman who died in garage crash is named
text: the woman who died when a car crashed into a used car sales forecourt has been named .
police said kelly pearce , 40 , was pronounced dead at the scene at hewas water near st austell on 25 june .
ms pearce was a passenger in a black vauxhall vectra which crashed into the forecourt of andrew toms cars and damaged 22 cars .
author: Miles Davis
BBC News Online

documents.title: devon iraq veteran 's paralympic dream
text: a veteran who lost his leg in an explosion in iraq has won a world cup race in spain , beating the world number one .
triathlete steven crowley won the world paratriathlon cup race in altafulla in spain .
but the cost of paying for his kit , including several different legs for competitions , is proving costly .
he is on the hunt for a sponsor and his goal is to represent great britain at the paralympic games in tokyo in 2020 .
author: Sophie Malcolm
BBC News Online

documents.title: latest travel in devon and cornwall
text: latest travel in devon and cornwall
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: paedophile councillor caught by vigilantes
text: a former councillor who was caught by a vigilante group as he tried to groom two young girls online has been jailed .
ralph sutton , 56 from combe martin , in devon , thought the girls were aged 12 and 13 - but they were fake profiles set up by a self-appointed paedophile hunter .
within hours of making contact he turned the chat to sex and made explicit suggestions to the girls .
he admitted five charges , including attempting to incite a child to sexual activity , and was jailed for 30 months .
author: Sian Davies
BBC News Online

documents.title: seven vodka bottles seized from six teenagers visiting newquay
text: seven bottles of vodka seized from teenagers visiting newquay were taken from one room with six 16 to 18-year-olds in it , police say .
inspector dave meredith , of devon and cornwall police , said the seizure was made during `` routine checks on various accommodation providers that we know take in 16 to 18-year-olds '' .
insp meredith has tweeted what he and other officers found , and appealed to parents to `` be responsible '' and not give alcohol to teenagers heading for the resort .
the town is expected to see thousands of teenage visitors over the next few months , with many being allowed to travel to cornwall alone with friends to celebrate the end of exams .
16-18 yr old 's now arriving in newquay .
7 bottles of vodka seized from one room today !
parents - do n't send your kids here with alcohol !
any more info on this dave ?
and please can we use the photo ?
yes , you can use the photo
wow !
this is a bad thing waiting to happen !
good on @ twitterid for being on the ball .
who knows where this would have ended
for an adult to buy or attempt to buy alcohol on behalf of someone under 18 charge parents with supplying drink to a minor .
hi dave please can you ring us on 01872475263 naomi bbc radio cornwall
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: car seized after driver found with 22 points on licence
text: this driver had 22 points on his expired licence and was still driving around # paignton seized and driver reported .
# betterpunishmentneeded
i really ca n't get my head around this so perhaps you could explain .
how does he still hold a licence having got 22 points ?
avril , it is an expired licence so will keep adding unless disqualified or revoked i believe
respectfully , although we know they exist , i 'm not sure you should be tweeting about shortcomings in the judicial process .
why not ?
it certainly seems to be the case with this individual .
how come it was n't caught sooner ?
the driver has been caught quite a few times , but racking up points isnt the right detterent , and with little income the fines are lower !
apart from prison , how else can you stop people driving when they should n't be ?
pity the law does n't allow us to crush them as well as there car
22 points how the system is an ass at least he 's off the road now
something needs changing .
the prolific are undeterred currently .
had a neighbour who did/does it over and over .
he be back on road day after i bet in another scrap car

documents.title: 'do n't climb up or down cliffs , ' rnli warns
text: beach users should be aware of the hazards involving cliffs and have been strongly advised by the rnli that they `` do n't attempt to climb up or down the cliffs '' .

the call , from the st agnes rnli crew , comes after they had to assist in rescuing a woman who was seriously injured after falling about 15ft ( 4.5m ) at trevaunance point , near st agnes , on saturday evening .
the st agnes rnli lifeboat , coastguard search and rescue team and paramedics were called to the scene for a rescue operation that took about 90 minutes to complete .

st agnes rnli operations manager bruce baker said : `` beach users should be aware of the hazards involving cliffs and we would strongly advise that you do n't attempt to climb up or down the cliffs .
the rocks can be slippery or unstable and you could easily lose your footing . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police commissioner : alison hernandez 'should stand down '
text: the vice chairman of a panel which oversees devon and cornwall 's elected police and crime commissioner says he `` quite honestly '' thinks she should step down .
it follows comments by conservative commissioner alison hernandez on bbc radio cornwall 's laurence reed show last month .
she said during the broadcast that she was interested in having a conversation with the chief constable about whether ordinary people with gun licences could assist in a terrorist crisis .

chris batters , vice chairman of the police and crime panel , which scrutinises the role of the commissioner , said : `` i think alison has made various statements - this being one of the major ones - which , at times , should not have made . ''
when asked if she should stand down , he said that , despite her being an `` experienced politician '' , that `` quite honestly , i think she should '' .
plymouth city council has passed a motion of no confidence in ms hernandez , which she said she was `` disappointed about '' .
she said she did n't want to see armed vigilantes roaming the streets `` but a discussion about how the public responds to any immediate terror threat is completely valid '' .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: tunes in the dunes : feedback feelers out after overcrowding and poor sound complaints
text: organisers of the tunes in the dunes music event at perranporth have asked festival goers to send feedback to them following complaints about overcrowding and poor sound .
they said on facebook they understood that some people may not have enjoyed the festival this weekend and they want to hear from them .
people were given free tickets for saturday and sunday events after the headline act primal scream was cancelled on friday because of bad weather .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: call for teenagers to get vaccinated against meningitis and septicaemia
text: parents across devon and cornwall are being urged to remind teenagers to get vaccinated against deadly meningitis and septicaemia .
public health england ( phe ) said cases caused by an aggressive menw strain are on the rise and the menacwy vaccine was `` the best form of protection against these deadly diseases '' .
the first 18 months of a menacwy vaccination programme saw more than two million teenagers receive the vaccine , but there were still many more who needed it , phe said .
vaccination was available at gp practices , it added .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: culdrose helicopter is first aircraft to land on carrier hms queen elizabeth
text: a merlin helicopter from a cornwall military base has become the first aircraft to land on the flight deck of the new aircraft carrier , hms queen elizabeth , the royal navy says .
the 14-tonne rnas culdrose aircraft , from 820 naval air squadron , set down on the four-acre deck days after the vessel left rosyth to begin trials in the north sea .

the ship 's commanding officer , captain jerry kyd , said : `` it 's an exciting and historic event which marks the beginning of the ship 's life as the nation 's flagship and the future of carrier-based aviation . ''
the squadron will be assigned to hms queen elizabeth throughout the 50-year lifespan of the 65,000-tonne warship .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: travel : slow traffic on a30 and a39
text: travel : slow traffic on a30 and a39
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: banned head teacher can not apply for order to be lifted for four years
text: a head teacher from cornwall banned after being told she showed a `` complete disregard '' for safeguarding her pupils can not ask for the prohibition order to be set aside for four years , profession bosses say .

sarah cooke , former principal of foxhole academy , near st austell , has been banned from teaching indefinitely by the education minister from any school , sixth form college , relevant youth accommodation or children 's home in england .

the decision came after a national college for teaching and leadership ( nctl ) panel last month ruled she breached professional standards over a possible safeguarding issue relating to a police caution her husband , peter , had over stolen underwear .
however , the ruling said that she `` may apply for the prohibition order to be set aside , but not until 30 june 2021 '' .
it added : `` this is not an automatic right to have the prohibition order removed .
if she does apply , a panel will meet to consider whether the prohibition order should be set aside .
without a successful application , mrs sarah kate cooke remains prohibited from teaching indefinitely . ''
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: vodka seized by police from teenagers ' room in newquay
text: newquay has seen problems with teenagers with alcohol coming into the town at the beginning of the summer previously .
insp meredith 's tweet sees the renewal of previous appeals for parents to `` be responsible '' and not give alcohol to teenagers heading for the resort .
the town is expected to see thousands of teenage visitors over the next few months , with many being allowed to travel to cornwall alone with friends to celebrate the end of exams .
initiatives including the multi-agency newquay safe partnership work to prevent underage drinking .
16-18 yr old 's now arriving in newquay .
7 bottles of vodka seized from one room today !
parents - do n't send your kids here with alcohol !
any more info on this dave ?
and please can we use the photo ?
yes , you can use the photo
wow !
this is a bad thing waiting to happen !
good on @ twitterid for being on the ball .
who knows where this would have ended
for an adult to buy or attempt to buy alcohol on behalf of someone under 18 charge parents with supplying drink to a minor .
hi dave please can you ring us on 01872475263 naomi bbc radio cornwall
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: exeter praise chelsea conduct in ampadu move
text: exeter city chairman julian tagg says premier league champions chelsea have `` behaved impeccably '' in their pursuit of 16-year-old defender ethan ampadu .
welshman ampadu joined chelsea on saturday , though a fee is yet to be agreed between the two clubs for the player .
chelsea have behaved impeccably throughout the lead up to this point and therefore we are hoping through these negotiations we will avoid the need for a tribunal , '' said tagg .
`` however , we - like any other club - will reserve our right to do that should we need to . ''
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: travel : problems on the a30 in devon
text: travel : problems on the a30 in devon
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: teeth-cleaning driver has brush with law 'because she was running late '
text: a driver stopped by police after being seen cleaning her teeth while driving in a fast lane of a dual carriageway said she was `` running late '' , a senior police officer says .
east cornwall police commander superintendent ian drummond-smith revealed on twitter this morning that he stopped the driver after he spotted what she was doing behind him on the a30 near exeter .
he said : `` of course she said she was running late and , as you can imagine , that did n't garner much sympathy from me .
`` i explained she 'd be running even later if she crashes . ''
driving to hq this morning stopped car behind me as driver cleaning teeth in fast lane !
had a chat about safety & deaths on the roads
hi ian , where on the a30 was this ?
thanks !
hi ollie .
at exeter
i once saw a man shaving while driving on the m5 .
thankfully electric not wet-shave , but still pretty stupid .
great to see you use your rvm boss , but how you pulled him over from that position is dark arts territory
good work boss .
hopefully they will reconsider their options next time
i 'd have thanked them for making sure their breath would be fresh for those giving mouth to mouth then see if it sunk in
well done .
thanks .
but `` fast lane '' ?
language is important .
@ adrianleisk
he must have been chomping at the bit to get to work
it 's not exactly the most taxing of activities is it
do you have any more info on this please ian ?
when and where abouts did it happen ?
thanks !
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police commissioner no confidence vote : alison hernandez 'disappointed '
text: devon and cornwall police and crime commissioner says she is `` disappointed '' that plymouth city council passed a motion of no confidence in her .
the motion about alison hernandez , passed by 26 to 25 , was debated by the conservative and ukip-run authority after it was proposed by labour councillor chris penberthys on monday .
it followed comments by the conservative commissioner on bbc radio cornwall 's laurence reed show last month .
she said during the broadcast that she was interested in having a conversation with the chief constable about whether ordinary people with gun licences could assist in a terrorist crisis .
responding to the motion , she said : `` i am disappointed about the outcome of the vote , which i do not believe represents the wider plymouth community .
it will not detract me from representing the views of the public which is central to my role .
`` as previously stated , i do n't want to see armed vigilantes roaming the streets , but a discussion about how the public responds to any immediate terror threat is completely valid . ''
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: slow traffic in exeter and on a39
text: slow traffic in exeter and on a39
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: questions at kingsbridge masterplan council meeting
text: a scheme to reshape the centre of kingsbridge was met with concerned questions at a meeting last night .
people have until sunday to comment on the evolving masterplan from south hams district council which would include 50 homes on the quayside car park .
at a packed st edmund 's church , some locals were positive but critics said they were worried about the impact on the area .
the council said the total scheme could provide affordable homes alongside reduced price community housing , and added it could find more parking in the town 's under-utilised car parks .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: counterfeit clothes donated to charity
text: about 5,000 items of counterfeit clothes seized by trading standards officers have been donated to charity , staff say .

devon and somerset trading standards said the clothes - including tracksuits , t-shirts , sweatshirts and trainers - were seized by officers across the area and were now bound for a charity which collected unwanted clothes .
officers added that the seizures not only removed the items from the market and disrupted the activities of organised criminal gangs , but also reduced the volume of waste being sent to landfill .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: burst water main in tedburn st mary
text: ex66af : no water in # tedburnstmary due to a burst .
engineers onsite & aim to restore supplies by 14:20 .
further info

documents.title: power cut in tiverton
text: the estimated time of restoration for the # powercut in # tiverton # ex16 is currently 15:30 .
our apologies for any inconvenience .
david .

documents.title: tunes in the dunes organisers respond to complaints following festival
text: organisers of the tunes in the dunes festival have been forced to address criticisms of the weekend 's three-day event which has been dubbed a `` total mess '' .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: 'early start ' for fire crews at newquay suspected arson
text: firefighters in cornwall said they had `` an early start this morning '' after being called to a blaze at a derelict building which they suspect was arson .
crews from newquay , st columb and penzance put out the fire after being called to the small building in narrowcliff in newquay at about 06:30 .
police are investigating .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: protest pushes for better help for disabled children in cornwall
text: a protest has been held outside county hall in truro to push for better help for disabled children in cornwall .
parents said their children were being failed by the health and education systems in the county .
cornwall council said it recognised the importance in the provision of high quality services to keep children and young people safe , and enabling them to make good or better progress .
author: Denis Nightingale
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: latest weather : cloud clearing
text: cloud will continue to lift and break as patchy light rain or drizzle dies out and sunny spells develop .
light southwesterly winds will become more variable later today .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f ) .
tonight , although a few isolated light showers are possible , these will clear away eastwards to leave a largely dry night with clear spells developing .
winds will become mainly north or northeasterly and light or moderate in strength .
minimum temperature : 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Kevin Thomas
BBC Weather Forecaster

documents.title: details of major new 'urban extension ' of newton abbot revealed - including 1,275 homes
text: detailed plans for more than 1,000 new homes on the edge of newton abbot have been revealed .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: ministers 'in the dark ' over scale of child vulnerability
text: ministers do not know how many hundreds of thousands of children in england are living risky or vulnerable lives , says children 's commissioner anne longfield .
england 's children 's champion has tried to calculate the total in a report , in the absence of overall official data .
she found some 670,000 children live in high risk family situations , thousands with parents in addiction treatment .
children 's minister robert goodwill said support for vulnerable children was being given across government .
but he acknowledged there was more to do .
author: BBC News Education

documents.title: torquay 's palace hotel to close at end of july
text: one of torquay 's major hotels is to close at the end of the month , its operators have confirmed .

operators of the palace hotel in babbacombe road said its new owners had `` significant plans '' to redevelop the 25-acre site , that it was to shut `` to allow for this '' , and redundancy consultations had begun with staff .
torquay palace ltd added : `` all guests who have bookings for the period beyond 31 july will be contacted and we are seeking to assist with alternative venues where possible .

`` we apologise for any inconvenience that this may cause and , in particular , are very sorry to be consulting with staff regarding redundancy , many of whom have loyally served the business for decades . ''
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: man raped student three times as she drifted into unconsciousness , court told
text: a man who offered to walk a drunk student home raped her three times as she drifted in and out of consciousness and told her not to be a baby when she told him to stop , a court heard .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: life in the fast lane : motorist stopped by police for cleaning teeth while driving
text: a driver has been stopped after cleaning their teeth while driving in a fast lane of a dual carriageway , a senior police officer says .

east cornwall police commander superintendent ian drummond-smith said on twitter he was driving to the force 's headquarters at middlemoor , near exeter in devon , this morning when he spotted the driver behind him on the a30 and stopped them .
after stopping the driver , supt drummond-smith said he `` had a chat about safety and deaths on the roads '' .
driving to hq this morning stopped car behind me as driver cleaning teeth in fast lane !

documents.title: grant came 'very close ' to exeter city stay
text: jamaica international forward joel grant says he came `` very close '' to staying with exeter city before joining their devon rivals plymouth argyle .
the 29-year-old turned down a new deal at beaten league two play-off finalists exeter to join the third-tier pilgrims .
`` not everyone will understand my reasoning but those who do , hopefully they understand , '' he told bbc radio devon .
`` the club offered me a deal which we tried to negotiate and it just did n't end probably the way it could 've . ''
author: James Law
BBC Sport Online

documents.title: 'lax safeguarding attitude ' head teacher banned from teaching
text: a head teacher from cornwall who showed a `` complete disregard '' for safeguarding her pupils and failed to disclose her school caretaker husband 's police caution has been banned from the classroom .
sarah cooke was principal of foxhole academy near st austell where peter cooke carried out occasional maintenance .

a national college for teaching and leadership ( nctl ) professional misconduct panel last month found she did not tell bosses of a possible safeguarding issue relating to a 2012 police caution to mr cooke for stealing underwear .
it ruled she breached professional standards , found her guilty of five charges of wrongdoing , and also said she showed `` a lax attitude '' to safeguarding before recommending a prohibition order .
the education secretary has agreed to ban her from teaching indefinitely , and she can not teach in any school , sixth form college , relevant youth accommodation or children 's home in england .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: garage forecourt crash death woman named
text: a woman who died when the car she was travelling in came off a main road and smashed into a row of parked cars on a garage forecourt has been named as 40-year-old kelly pearce .
the vauxhall vectra she was a passenger in left the a390 at hewas water on sunday 25 june .
it crashed into the andrew toms cars dealership , damaging more than 20 other vehicles .
ms pearce , who was local to the area , was pronounced dead at the scene , and the male driver of the car was still in hospital with serious injuries , devon and cornwall police said .
the road was closed for eight hours for investigations .
police have renewed an appeal for witnesses of the crash itself , but also asked for anyone who stopped at the scene to assist and may have left before officers arrived to get in contact .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: closing date revealed for six libraries with four more to be 'cut off '
text: the axe has finally fallen on six libraries after a vote on monday , with the community facilities set to close on 16 september .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: 'despondent ' man taken to hospital after dartmoor search
text: a man has been taken to hospital after a rescue operation on dartmoor , a search team says .
the dartmoor search and rescue team said on facebook that it had a call-out just before midnight `` to search for a despondent male whose car had been found near two bridges '' .
police , firefighters , search dogs and a helicopter were involved in the operation in what rescuers said was a `` misty night '' with visibility often down to 20m .
the man was found in the early hours of tuesday `` tucked into some rocks on littaford tor '' with some injuries .
he was taken to hospital for assessment and treatment and searchers were stood down at 04:00 .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: police commissioner no confidence vote : 'gun comments show she is not fit for this job '
text: plymouth city council passed a motion of no confidence in devon and cornwall police commissioner alison hernandez because `` she should go '' after firearms comments , the council 's labour group leader says .
the motion , passed by one vote , follows comments by the conservative commissioner on bbc radio cornwall 's laurence reed show last month .
she said she was interested in having a conversation with the chief constable about whether ordinary people with gun licences could assist in a terrorist crisis .
tudor evans ( leader of the labour group on the conservative and ukip-run authority , said her comments showed she was `` not fit for this job '' .
the council would not have the powers to sack alison hernandez , but the vote will increase pressure on the commissioner , who has already faced calls to resign .
her office has not yet commented on the vote .
at the time , ms hernandez said her comments had been `` misinterpreted '' and she was not advocating the use of firearms by members of the public during a terrorist incident .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: calls for post-brexit laws to protect dolphins from fishing gear
text: campaigners say there must be laws in place post-brexit to protect dolphins from dying in fishing nets and gear .
a petition to fisheries minister george eustice has reached about 54,000 signatures amid fears most of the protection currently comes from the eu .

it comes as the cornwall wildlife trust says there have already been 187 reported dolphins and porpoises washing up dead on cornish beaches this year , with the sharpest rise ever recorded between january and april .
author: BBC Spotlight

documents.title: councils warn of £ 5.8bn 'funding gap ' by 2020
text: english local authorities face a £ 5.8bn funding gap by 2020 without new sources of revenue , council chiefs are warning .
services are running on a `` shoestring '' and councils must be at the `` front of the queue '' for extra cash , the local government association will say later .
its chair , lord porter , will argue they must be free to raise more council tax and keep all business rates income .
ministers say a £ 2.3bn infrastructure fund for councils will speed up the process of building new homes .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: high tide times for the region
text: if you 're planning a trip to the coast or seaside , here are the next high water times around devon and cornwall .
we 'll have the latest forecast on bbc spotlight at 13:30 .
author: Dan Downs, Weather Forecaster

documents.title: cornwall amputee boy marshall janson in skateboarding plea
text: cornish wonderboy marshall janson has taken up a new sport - skateboarding .
marshall , who 's nine , had all of his limbs amputated due to meningitis as a baby , but he 's not letting that stop him .
but there 's a problem - he finds it painful to propel himself on his skateboard because of his sensitive skin grafts .
his family is asking if anyone has any suggestions to help .
footage from studio sw
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: businessman who bit stranger 's cheek could be jailed
text: a businessman who bit a stranger 's cheek causing significant injury in what was described as a 'pretty unpleasant assault ' has been told he could be jailed .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: latest weather : brightening after a cloudy start
text: after a rather cloudy start to the day across devon , some bright or sunny spells will develop into the afternoon .
it will stay largely dry for most places , although there is a chance of the odd light shower at times .
maximum temperature : 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Dan Downs, Weather Forecaster

documents.title: high and medium pollen count in south west
text: # pollencount will be high to moderate across the southern half of the country today , but low further north .
stav d
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: plymouth city council approves plans to close six libraries
text: plymouth city council has approved plans to close six of the city 's 17 branches .
ten branches had initially been earmarked to shut .
that was later amended to branches in eggbuckland , ernesettle , laira , stoke , tothill and west park after a consultation .
they are to close their doors for good after a full council vote on monday approved the move .
the council said during the consultation that trying to operate a total of 17 libraries was `` unsustainable '' and a `` drain on resources '' .
the council said it also planned to invest more then £ 250,000 in modernising the service , including redeveloping its st budeaux site .
other modernisations would include providing an outreach service and enhancing online services , it said .
the modernisation of plymouth 's library service through the plan for libraries has been approved by the full council
tory/ukip cuts .
no more no less .
shame on you
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: gypsy clairvoyant ca n't see future for palm readers
text: plymouth-based david broadway , better known as `` gipsy acora '' , has been reading palms for more than 50 years , but now he believes this ancient roma tradition is dying out .
he said : `` there are very few travellers that come into this world and take up palmistry .
so in a sense i 'm the last in the line . ''
gypsy and traveller groups have said palmistry has declined as communities have become more integrated with mainstream society .
new generations are now less likely to be taught the tradition or take it up as a profession .
author: Patrick Clahane
BBC South West

documents.title: neo-nazi group leave racist 'white zone ' poster on plymouth woman 's car
text: a plymouth woman has spoken of her shock after a `` disgraceful '' racist neo-nazi sticker was left on her car .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: cannabis found in disused factory
text: huge cannabis grow found @ disused factory in hatherleigh on saturday.old fashioned police work sniffed it out.any info call 101 63/1st july

documents.title: busy night for cornwall lifeboat and coastguard rescue teams
text: it 's been a busy night for lifeboat and coastguard rescue teams , with crews in three areas in action on the north coast .
coastguards received a mayday call from a yacht off the north coast near st agnes which was taking on water at about 22:15 on monday .
by the time a lifeboat from st ives arrived , one person on board had managed to stem the flow of water .
the vessel was towed into st ives at about 02:30 this morning .
rescue teams from newquay and padstow spent almost two hours searching for what they described as a high-risk missing person in the newquay area overnight .
the search was called off just before 03:00 after a car was found on porth beach .
coastguards said the person they were looking for had made his way inland and the teams were stood down .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: plymouth council passes vote of no confidence in police commissioner alison hernandez
text: plymouth city council has narrowly passed a motion of no confidence in devon and cornwall police and crime commissioner alison hernandez .
the motion , passed by 26 to 25 , was proposed by labour councillor chris penberthys .

it said : `` plymouth city council is extremely alarmed at the recent comments from conservative police and crime commissioner alison hernandez about licensed firearm owners being allowed to act during terrorist incidents .
ms hernandez 's statement that she would `` really be interested '' in the suggestion shows she is unfit and unsuitable for office . ''
her comments were made on laurence reed 's phone-in on bbc radio cornwall last month .

she was asked by a caller who said they were an `` ex-registered firearms dealer '' and a gun owner in the bude area : `` if there should ever be a terrorist attack close to the town centre , what happens if people like i and others try to defend themselves using those guns ? ''
ms hernandez replied that it was `` a very good question '' and she wanted it put to her in writing .
when challenged by laurence reed if she was advocating vigilantes , ms hernandez said : `` i 'm just saying let 's officially have a look at that and see what would be the implications of it .
let 's un it a little bit . ''
her office said it had no comment to make yet on the council vote .
at the time , she said her words had been `` misinterpreted '' and she was not advocating the use of firearms by members of the public during a terrorist incident .
author: Andrew Segal
Local Live

documents.title: news , sport , weather and travel for tuesday
text: good morning from bbc local live .
we 'll be bringing you the news , sport , travel and weather for devon and cornwall today .

author: Andrew Segal
